name: Couples Swept Away

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I traveled here March 1st-4th for a quick "babymoon" getaway. We had called the night before to request a room not facing the road, since both my husband and I are sensitive to noise. We were guaranteed that. Upon arrival, the front desk attendant assured us our room was not facing the road said no other rooms were available anyway since the hotel was sold out. (room 2206) We got to the room and the whole window behind the bed was open to the road..We could hear every honk, splash, (it was raining) and engine over the TV. We called down to see if we could get a different room and was told "sure". (Wondering why the check in person lied to us saying no other room was available) We then changed rooms, with tolerable road noise. Then another story..after checking in we went to make dinner reservations. She told us they were all booked up. We told her we were only there 3 nights and would like to have at least one night to eat in a nice restaurant (especially since we pre-paid for it). She said "no problem" then and booked us for 7:30 at Lemongrass the same night. So, we go to dinner and they have no record of our reservation. At this point, my husband is really mad since they have been not truthful to us since arrival. We get to talk to a night duty manager who has no power and does nothing but tell us it is our fault. This was our first night experience..wasted. The next two days were better. The beach and ocean is great. You do have to get up early though to reserve a seat and hope that smokers or loud talkers don't sit near you. The food was great too. We really enjoyed the vegetarian restaurant with the sushi and sweet potatoes chips at lunch. We left on a bad note, however, when a waitress was very rude about me drinking a cup of coffee at breakfast. She didn't even want to serve it to me b/c I am pregnant. Overall, would be a great vacation if the staff was honest and truly cared about the guest experience. Would not return here for sure!!
reviews.title: Not what expected...disappointed to say the least

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I returned from a week at this resort. The resort is smaller than some huge chains (Iberostar, Riu), which in my opinion is an asset. The overall layout of the hotel is fantastic (best of the all inclusives we have been to). The food is excellent, every restaurant and every meal exceeded our expectations. The menus did change while we were there, so you never get tired of the options.
reviews.title: Definitely a 4.5 star...with a 5+ star beach!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012
reviews.text: The entertainment is also top notch. The shows they put on are very high quality and it isn't the beach staff lip-synching at night, which is what you typically get.
reviews.title: Couldn't be better!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was right on the beach (1229) and it was an atrium suite (no TV). From reading other reviews and looking on their website we weren't expecting modern decor, but you really feel like you are in a tropical destination with the wood decor. Aside from having far less patio furniture than everyone else and quite a few bugs in the room, we had no issues with the room at all.
reviews.title: Amazing wedding venue

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Some people have commented on the age groups at the resort and I would say there is a wide variety. It is not a party hotel, although there were a couple of larger wedding groups that did party a bit (didn't bother us) while we were there, but overall it is a much more relaxed vibe. If you want to go party hard 24/7 this probably isn't the resort for you.
reviews.title: Best Beach Ever!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at Couples Swept Away from the 6th of February to the 13th. What a great place. It is not as posh as some of the other places we have stayed, no marble bathrooms, no grand main desk and no spectacular fountain at the entrance. If that is what you like about resorts, this isn't the place for you. If you are looking for a low-key, very attentive but not pushy serivce, attention to detail place then you should go to CSA. The resort is spread out enough that even when at capacity - which it was while we were there - it doesn't seem crowded. The food was really good, not quite the variety we have had at larger resorts and the lunch buffet while good never wowed us. That said, the romantic dinner on the beach (one of the few things that has an extra charge) was one of the best meals we have ever had and Patois - the a la carte, non reservation restaurant - was great. The beach is wonderful, the sporting facilities are great and the staff are amazing. CSA is a place you go to for the energy not the buildings. The relaxed and friendly feel here are second to none. We made more friends in the week we were there than any other two weeks at other resorts. As our travel agent told us, "Love is in the air and everyone around is breathing it". We loved it at CSA and have already booked another trip there for the end of June.
reviews.title: The most relaxing vacation we have ever had

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This review is long overdue. My husband and I stayed at Couples Swept Away in October. Prior to deciding on CSA, we were going to stay at a Sandals Resort. However, after comparing the reviews, the menus, the activities, and the values, CSA won out "hands down". And I am so glad it did. We have traveled throughout Europe and the Middle East, the Bahamas (including several trips to Atlantis), Mexico and the Florida Beaches. This was a long overdue vacation for us and prior to our trip we would review the resort, the reviews, photos, restaurant menus, activities, etc. We had both long wanted to go to Negril. My husband even got a book on how to speak Jamaican and that only added to our excitement and anticipation! Everything went perfect with one exception. The morning of our departure to Jamaica, I came down with a terrible flu; you know the kind, sore throat, body aches, fever, head ache...need I say more? When we arrived at the airport in Montego Bay, we were escorted to Couples' reception room and served cold Red Stripe. I'm not a beer drinker (I much prefer wine or liquor) but it was great! The trip to CSA was so enjoyable; we loved the beautiful countryside and the views of the water. I would say we were already in love with Jamaica. But if the trip to CSA was the "courting" portion of our love affair with Jamaica, CSA was the honeymoon! When we arrived I was immediately impressed as the women were served chilled champagne and cold towels while the men completed the check in. My husband and I were escorted to our Ocean Front Suite by a fabulous young man named Webba. Webba was incredibly considerate, professional and helpful and let me know that there was a nurse on duty during the day at the resort. We had the most fabulous room I could ever imagine. It was everything and more than I expected. We were ground floor with our deck opening onto the beach with only the beach bar in between. I was so sick that, when we first got there, I could only drink Ting and the young men in the beach bar would have one ready for me when I got to the bar. The second day, I was introduced to an "old Jamaican remedy" for a cold or flu. Breathing the fumes from a papertowel soaked in Conquering Lion (162 proof rum) really opened up my sinuses and, by the second day, I was feeling much better. Webba called each morning to see if I was feeling better and if we needed any restocking of our room refrigerator. We had agreed to try all the restaurants but after dining at The Palms, we only tried Lemongrass once(which was incredibly awesome) but never made it to Feathers. My husband went diving each day; I was just too sick. But not too sick to make to The Palms for breakfast and lunch. The restaurant manager, Mr. Derrick Stephenson, exuded polite, sincere professionalism. I looked forward everyday to his warm welcome. The staff of The Palms were equally warming and I am still impressed by their caring and welcoming ways. And the food was soooo good. I'm usually a picky eater and my husband is very picky but that food was the best! We visited the martini bar each night after dinner. I had heard about a layered shot called the Bob Marley and when I asked about it at the martini bar, the bar tenders were excited to make it and made us feel like we were drinking something really special. We went to the Aura night club and had a blast. On our last day at the resort we decided to take the Catamaran cruise and we both went into the water and swam through the caves. Just an unbelievable experience. After we got off the boat, I bought a few souveniers; a couple of drums for my granddaughters that were made by Rasta Ralph and we (Rasta Ralph and I) put our hands over them while he said a blessing over them. When I told that to my granddaughters (age 5 and 6), their eyes got so big and, to this day, they bring their drums out when their parents have company over and tell the company the story of the Rasta Ralph, the blessing and the drums. When we got off the boat, my husband and I discovered that the sandals we left at the dive shack were gone. His were crocs and mine Ralph Lauren. My husband said, "we will never see those again". However, the next morning, the nice young man from the boat stopped me as I was walking to breakfast and told me he had our sandals. He had taken them inside the boat shack, brushed the sand off and cleaned them up for us. I offered him some money for that but he wouldn't take it. I actually think it offended him. So I can't say enough about CSA. We are back at work now and I'm working 70 hr work weeks. Planning our return to CSA this October is the dream that gets me through these 10 hr day/7 days a week work weeks. Thank you Couples Swept Away. I will always be in love with you!
reviews.title: Couples Swept Away is incredible beyond imagination

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Arrival:
reviews.title: Fantastic, Amazing, Unbelievably Romantic!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Where do I begin, ok well to start off if you have never been to Jamaica, please don't expect fast paced hussle and bussle of your everyday life, but do expect laid back friendly people that if you treat kindly and with respect your every wish they will make come true! Ok now, once we arrived to Montego Bay we were greated by a Couples representative and given a glass of champagen and beer, that was great after a long exhausting trip, next off to our bus we went and were immediatley driven to the resort which took about 1 1/2 hours with traffic once we arrived at the resort we were again received with a glass of champagne and a cool refreshing hand towel to cool off, the check in process took a total of 15 minutes, this was amazing!
reviews.title: Beyond all expectations!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Next off to our room , now I don't understand what ppl here complain about because honestly you get what you paid for and we paid for a Garden Verandah Suite and it was faboulous, clean, smelled fresh and no there was no Noisy traffic to keep us awake, yes there were ants but that was because we left food out overnight, but Room Service sprayed it down and cleaned it up therefore no more ants.
reviews.title: We switched from cruising to staying with Couples in Negril

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We booked CSA in January of 2010 for an escape from the New England weather in March 2010 and we were not in the least bit disappointed with anything. The only problem was that we didn't book a long enough trip! We stayed for 7 nights and wished we had booked 10! I always rely on TripAdvisor when booking my vacations and this is the second time I have booked a trip based on others reviews and absolutely loved my trip. This time, I thought I would write a review of my own in hopes that it will help someone else choose a fantastic vacation.
reviews.title: CSA is a Fantastic place in the Caribbean - Will definitely be back!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were looking for a relaxing vacation with no worries or plans in advance. CSA had the perfect mix for us. We found the activities provided by the resort perfect and right up our alley, namely the daily Scuba Diving. We did go on two excursions outside of the resort and fully enjoyed both of them. Chukka Dune Buggies and Rhodes Hall Plantation Horse Back Riding.
reviews.title: Yeah mon!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The property at Swept Away is peaceful and romantic with lot's of winding pathways lit with twinkly lights at night. The beach has sugary sand and the water is a perfect 79 degrees. CSA keeps the beach immaculate and has excellent security keeping the "vendors" away from the guests. They are not allowed past the surf line and a simple no thanks sends them on their way. The green flag in the sand to signal you would like a beverage was probably my favorite service! I never did get my hands on those cold towels that come around but did enjoy the fruit kabobs. The beach and activities get a perfect score from me. On to the food and beverages.....We ate at all of the restaurants on the property and loved every single one! The service is excellent especially for the ladies. They actually understand how things are supposed to work down there! Love it! I read a couple of reviews that complained there wasn't enough food. I'll just clarify by saying that the meals are appropriately sized based on proper proportions and are fantastic. The food was wonderful and they really do have top shelf liquor. My only word of caution is in regards to housekeeping. You are given 4 towels each day and two are meant for the beach. If you like fresh towels or more than 1 each, then make sure to trade in your beach towels at the towel hut on the beach before heading back to your room. The resort is environmentally friendly and takes great strides to conserve water and energy. I applaud them for that.
reviews.title: Everything was fantastic- the beach, resort, water, location, sunsets, food... fabulous!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All in all, I can't say enough positive things about Couples Swept Away! It is a definite bargain for what you pay and get in return. The staff is wonderful and I am anxious to book my next trip back soon!!!
reviews.title: What A Week! The best vacation ever!
Couples Swept Away Negril
reviews.text: This was our first foray into the world of all-inclusive resorts and we can't say we're disappointed. The staff were extremely attentive and friendly at all times, from the gardeners, chambermaids to the restaurant and concierge staff.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our 5th trip to Swept Away and what can I say that has not already been said. This was our first stay at CSA in January; our previous stays were in October twice, November and May. I was a little apprehensive about staying during the "busy" season but CSA still lived up to my every expectation.
reviews.title: Once again, CSA delivers

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Food was fabulous-Not a problem making a restaurant reservation what so ever. We ate at Feathers once and Lemongrass twice. I was even able to order a birthday cake for my husband and it was delivered after our meal on his birthday. Patios was great and our favorite for breakfast and lunch. Dinners there were terrific, especially the lobster tail on Saturday night.
reviews.title: Perfect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Beach was gorgeous. Water a little cooler than in previous visits but still beautiful and refreshing. There was more chair saving than I was used to seeing but we were always able to find chairs. Of course, we liked being in the sun.
reviews.title: Still the best all inclucive............but

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010
reviews.text: Weather in January was the best we ever had. Sunny and warm with a beautiful breeze. And no humidity.
reviews.title: WOW!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Service as always was outstanding. The restaurant service did not miss a bit. Meals were paced perfectly and we never wanted for drinks.
reviews.title: 2nd Time Still Nice, But Rooms Really Need Updating

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is without doubt one of the best we have stayed in. Everything was of a very high standard it was indeed a pleasure to have stayed there. There was only one minor downer to mention which is the dreaded road noise ( i took some earplugs which helped ) I could go on too list all of the excellent points but i wont just read some other reviews . This is truly a relaxing , romantic and charming place made so by the very efficient staff. I would like too take this opportunity to thank them all and to Edwardo and Oral (thats what his name badge said) at the pool bar ,a special yeah mon.
reviews.title: Fantastic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Travelled to CSA for the week of March 22-2010. This was our first trip to Jamaica and we loved it.
reviews.title: Sweet

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only negative to CSA was our room, we were in bldg 3 room 1105 and it is a ground floor room on the end of the bldg. This room was very noisy especially first thing in the morning with guests and emloyees with carts going by. There is also a lot of road noise as well. We did asked to be moved but the only rooms available were also close to the road or the restaurants and would be just as noisy. The only option was to upgrade to a beach front for $77 a night which we were not prepared to do, so we just sucked it up and made the best of it. We also encountered numerous other guest who had moved or upgraded for the same reason. However if you were prepared to complain loudly and often seems you will be accomodated. Again we were not prepared to do that.
reviews.title: Couples Swept Away- Problems Galore

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our advice is to know what you are getting and request a particlar room or ask for a quiet room before you go. Better yet upgrade before you go and the hotel will have no choice but to accomodate you. It was also strange not to have a tv or fridge in the room. This was the first time ever we have had neither, I do like to watch a little TV while my wife is getting ready. Again know what you are getting before you go, it was partially our fault for no doing much research before we left.
reviews.title: Expensive but worth it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having said that, if not for the room the holiday would have been perfection, we are seasoned travellers and have never been treated so well. I took some snacks with me to tide me over and never even ate them as the food was awesome and plentifull.
reviews.title: Couples Swept Away has it all on a magnificent beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was 3rd vaca to Jamaica, but our first to CSA. We loved it. We booked an Atrium room and was offered an upgrade which we declined. LOVED our open air room. The 2nd floor patio was large and roomy. We had a view of the ocean. I would not spend the money to be ocean front because they have less privacy with the foot traffic. This was the first AI trip for us where the food was quite good. A la carte breakfast excellent. Room service was delivered right on time as requested. Also, no kids, no drunk groups or singles yelling "woo-hoo" a nice perk. At that time we paid $3000 total for a week stay, including non-stop air and trip insurance. This trip was for total relaxation after months of stressful family illness and provided for fantastic stress relief. Would go again!
reviews.title: Perfect Adult Vacation!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009
reviews.text: I have never seen such a high class hotel where everything is perfect. Most meals are a la carte and the food is always great. Fresh towels 3 times a day in your room. Excursions included. Wet towels at your chair on the beach as well as fruit brochettes. Staff highly attentive to your needs, always smiling and they don't accept tips. Beach is clean and water is turquoise with no algues. Sand is white. Seven mile beach that you can walk. Security Gards on the beach. Reggae bands coming on the beach to entertain was really cool. Best vacation ever. Nothing to compare with Dominican resorts or resorts in Cuba or in the Mayan river. Hope to go back! Let's not forget the jerk chicken: a must ! So delicious!
reviews.title: Best vacation ever... Would go back tomorrow...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: From the minute we arrived at the resort we were impressed with the staff. We had a long day of travel, and it was nice that check in was quick and efficient. We were in our room less than 1/2hr after arrival. The room was clean, and ready for us. We stayed in a Garden Suite, and have no complaints at all. We managed to eat at every resturant available. I was extreamly happy with the quality of the food. I did hear some complaints about portion size at feathers...but hey its all-inclusive...order another one! The drinks were great, using top shelf liquor as well. I found the bartenders very friendly and willing to make suggestions if you were not sure what you wanted to try. Every staff member I had the opportunity to interact with were very friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Book it now! You will love it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I spoke with several people who had been several times. One woman even claimed to be on her 18th trip there. 18! That tells me a lot!
reviews.title: Wish I was still there

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The available tour list is very extensive, and resonabaly priced. The tour desk was able to answer any questions about the tours, which was helpful in choosing which to do.
reviews.title: Realy: The Best

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We got Married at the Rui in Ochos Rios then spent our 2nd week Honeymoon in Negril..We have been to the Riu Tropical Palace twice before and Love Negril.
reviews.title: Perfect Honeymoon.Beachfront Veranda Room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: CSA didn't have the Large Marble Room like the Riu but it had wonderful charm and warmth. It was really fantastic to watch the Sunset each night from our room..very Romantic. The beds were comfortable and the rooms were perfect. After eating Buffet style the week before it was great to choose from a menu and relax.
reviews.title: Great Time.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: CSW is located in the best part of 7mile. Walking either way is fun and relaxing. The resort offers every activity, drink, food that you could ever dream of experiencing on a Vacation.
reviews.title: Great Vacation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As it is a couples Resort, it is very laid back so not for anyone looking for a wild time, although there are alot of bars on 7mile...Go you won't be disappointed. It was our 7th trip to J.A and we really loved this Resort. I would conclude this is the Best Resort in Negril.
reviews.title: best vacation yet

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It really depends on your socioeconomic background as to how you will view this place. The vast majority of people will have a great time in all regards. Some folks that have a higher level of expectations might want to look elsewhere. it is not by any means a sophisticated boutique hotel for the jet set. Its is essentially a land cruise that will put a smile on many peoples face.
reviews.title: BEST ESCAPE FROM ATLANTA SNOW JAM 2011 THERE COULD BE

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our second stay at Swept Away was even better than the first. And we did not think that was possible.
reviews.title: Swept Away for the Second Time

likes.liked: — Room, Food, Beach, Friendly service, No kids

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Where to start?
reviews.title: Absolutely Loved Every Minute!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Check-in was a breeze. We asked to upgrade when we arrived and very seamlessly the upgrade was made and we were on our way to our room. We upgraded to a beachfront suite and it was awesome. We fell asleep to the sounds of the waves and woke the same way. Very peaceful and quite. The bed is so comfortable. The shower was not as big as in the gardenview suite but we had a tub. There were also no outlets in the bathroom for hair appliances but management told us they are rectifying that situation.
reviews.title: We found our Jamaican home!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The beach is absolutely gorgeous. Never a problem finding a chair or a floatie. There are always those inconsiderate few who staked out a papayla in the morning and never used it but there is a ton of shade so there is never a problem finding a shady spot.
reviews.title: perfect for relaxing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Food was outstanding. Making a reservation for any of the restaurants was simple and easy. You can go as many times as you like and we were never told they were full. We ate at Feathers twice, Lemongrass twice and Patios Patio once. The food was varied and delicious. We varied lunch between the Palms and the Cabana Grill. We ate breakfast every morning at the buffet. They have ala carte breakfast at Patios Patio but we never got there. No complaints here about taste or variety. We did not eat at Seagrapes, there was nothing there that caught our interest.
reviews.title: Swept Away is our Happy Place!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After a terrible first half of our honeymoon at Grand Lido Negril, we were able to rebook the second half of the week at Couples Swept Away. We had considered both CSA and Couples Negril but after looking at CN, we chose the larger of the two resorts.
reviews.title: A Perfect Honeymoon!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was a great choice!!
reviews.title: Relaxing get away!

likes.liked: — Large deck, nice veiw, Good AC
likes.disliked: — Needs up dating, funky smell in room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: CSA is a beautiful resort set on the larger portion of Negril's Seven Mile Beach. The resort is a bit spread out and requires a decent amount of walking from your room to the restaurants and the beach, which did not bother us at all. We had booked a Beachfront Suite and the room was right on the beach with a partial view of the ocean. It was a typical Jamaican room with a comfortable bed, a decent sized bathroom, a large balcony and a full bar. If you want a TV in your room, make sure you book a room category that includes one as some of their rooms do not.
reviews.title: Beautiful beach resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food was great. We tried every restaurant and were not disappointed at any of them. We loved Lemon Grass. The ambiance was fabulous and the food was great. The buffet for both breakfast and lunch had every option you could think of and was much better than the two previous hotels we had been at.
reviews.title: Wonderful Weddingmoon

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We did not use the pools or the sports complex, although they seemed nice. We did book the shopping trip through the hotel. The driver was very flexible and willing to extend your time at one location or add stops if needed. We also went snorkeling through the hotel and were lucky enough to go with Trillan. He was great! We had a wonderful time!
reviews.title: Great Second Visit

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012
reviews.text: We loved every aspect of Couples Swept Away! Beautiful beach,wonderful people, great food and especially great service! So romantic! Gorgeous sunsets! Can't wait to go back to Couples Swept Away!!!!!
reviews.title: Love, love,love CSA! The most relaxing vacation ever!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at CSA over New Years - exceeded all my expectations - our upgraded room wasnt ready when we arrived so they put us in a standard room for 1 night and offered a $200 resort credit to make up for it! Rooms were incredibly clean, comfy beds. I've always been disappointed by the food at all-inclusives so the bar was set low - however, the food at this resort was awesome - book Feathers and LemonGrass more than once if you can. Staff was amazing - the New Years Eve celebrations were over the top and made the evening so special. There was also a good mix of people from all age groups (we are early 30's) which made for alot of fun
reviews.title: Best all-inclusive I've ever stayed at

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We went to Couples Swept Away for the second time and fell in love all over again. This time we took another couple with us and they fell in love along with us. First trip we had a great room with a partial ocean view and this time we had a garden room. It doesn't matter which room your in, because they are all beautiful. We loved our patio in the gardens.
reviews.title: Second trip just as good as first

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012
reviews.text: There is so much to do and see that is included with your stay. They have a sunset cruise (a must do...amazing!), snorkelling, a glass bottom boat, trips to Margaritaville, Negril and Rick's Cafe. We walked to Margaritaville, as it is only about a five minute walk on the beautiful beach.
reviews.title: Stress free vacation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012
reviews.text: If you love the ocean, then this is your resort. It is the most beautiful beach we have ever been on, and one of the reasons we will keep going back. Each chair has a floatie on the back and we had a great time with them one day we had waves in the ocean. The sunsets are spectacular!
reviews.title: Not quite what it says on the tin!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: OK, there are over 600 other reviews out there on CSA. Believe the majority; the place is great. We are experienced travelers in our late 50's and vacation in the Caribbean and Mexico frequently and this (our first time at CSA) was our second most favorite out of over 20 trips.
reviews.title: Fair Balance

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I truly can't imagine how anyone couldn't like the place. The setting is superb, accommodations are great, food is excellent and for the most part, service is very good. We actually liked this stop better than The Ritz Carlton in PR and that's saying something.
reviews.title: Already counting down to our next trip!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I think part of the problem that generates the few negative write-ups is that most travelers - especially the CSA repeaters - talk in such glowing terms about the place that expectations might be a bit overly expanded. Most of the praise is well-deserved, but to be fair there are a few slight negatives that if dwelled upon can poison the well a bit. The place is a bit "worn", but it's also functional and clean, so who cares? Food on occasion can be a bit uneven (we always avoid beef in the Caribbean if possible), but there's so much great food to pick from it doesn't matter. (It's an all-inclusive! - order a different dish if you're unhappy with the first!) Most servers are excellent - even without tipping. We did run into a couple of staff that were a bit ... let's say "distant". But they were by far in the minority and they still offered excellent service. (I do think the resort should allow tipping. It happens anyway and might generate a few more smiles.)
reviews.title: Second trip better than the first!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There are beach vendors offering parasailing, cigarettes, carvings, live music and yes, ganja (gasp!). These are all public beaches and anyone can walk below the high water mark. We found the venors infrequent, inoffensive and reactive to "no thanks". The guards are a bit lenient - probably because there are a fair amount of patrons (at all the resorts) for these services. (One of our beach highlights was a reggae rendition of "Sorry" by one of the musical groups and we brought home a very nice Couples Tree carving. My bad!!)
reviews.title: Even better the second time around!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a beach veranda suite on the third floor. In our opinion the best choice in the place. High enough so that the view is better and with a lot more privacy than ground level. Flat sceen TV is nice for news and the total mini-bar was a wonderful and often used amenity. This without compare is the best room view we have ever had!! The sunsets are spectacular!!
reviews.title: close but no cigar
CSA - Will never stay here again!
reviews.text: It all started out with the horrible "free" shuttle ride from the airport. They stuffed us into this small bus like sardines. They took up the last couple rows of seats with luggage, stacking them almost to the ceiling. Unfortunately me and my husband were the last two to board and got stuck in separate seats apart from eachother. Not the way I wanted to start my vacation spending an hour and a half sitting on a dirty bus without at least my husband to talk to.

reviews.title: Couples Swept Away over Couples Negril without question!!!
reviews.text: When we arrived things looked up, they had someone there to unload our bags, offered us a cold towel and champagne. Check-in was pretty painless, we followed the porter to our room with our bags. Then it went down hill again. Our room had a bad musty smell, and the a/c didn't work, it just blew out room temperature air along with an ashy black stuff that covered our bed and floor. Later that night however my husband climbed on a chair, banged on the unit and got it to work. For the rest of our vacation the room stayed nice and cool, only complaint I have is the a/c unit is attached to the wall up high by the ceiling, so it constantly blows down on the bed, so there was a continuous draft, I woke up many times in the night and my face/nose was cold! The bed....hard as a rock! Pillows, not much softer. My husband woke up a few times and his shoulder/arm had gone numb from sleeping on his side. One of my pet peeves about hotel beds is the mattress cover. The bottom sheet was simply tucked under the bed (no fitted sheet), we'd wake up each morning practically laying on the bare mattress.....no thanks!

reviews.title: Such a pleasant surprise!
reviews.text: The highlight of the trip was the beach, the pool, the overall grounds and the bar service. The beach was prestine, they kept it pretty clean, there were always ample chairs including floating mats which could be used to lounge in the ocean/pools. The flag service on the beach for when you needed drinks was awesome. The beach wait staff was great, so was the bar service. They had true top shelf liquor. The overall grounds were beautiful and well kept. The pools were small but nice, water was heated but refreshing. The pool swim up bar was great. Another good note was their fitness center and spa, both were great, I had a great pedicure and massage and my husband enjoyed the weight room.

reviews.title: Excellent!!!!!
reviews.text: Now....on to the food and restaurant service....one word....AWFUL! Maybe it's to be expected since we were in the carribean, but all the food there was carribean style, for which nether one of us took a liking to. It was almost impossible to find something just "normal" to eat. The service at the restaurants was horrible too. They were so unorganized, we never knew who our waitress was, it took 20mins to get a drink. Once during bkfast, me and my husband got up at the same time to go up to the buffet and when we returned they had cleared our table! When I stopped a waiter and asked for some place settings and more coffee, he said ok, but never returned. Room service was limited to breakfast. The milk was warm, they included no sugar or sweetner for coffee, waste of time!

reviews.title: Awesome Resort
reviews.text: BEES....they are everywhere, swarming in and around all the bars, the soda machine at the Cabana Grill was always teaming with them. Once while we had breakfast at Patios, my husband got half way through a glass of soda and found three dead bees floating in it. To top it off we told the waitress and she apologized but didn't seem to be very concerned. Also regarding bugs, we learned a lesson after the first night, don't leave any soda cans or food laying around for too long. We woke up the first morning with the night table covered in small ant like bugs because we made the mistake of leaving a sode can out.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our 2nd visit to Swept Away and believe me we were swept away again!
reviews.title: Absolute Paradise - Again!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just returned from 2 weeks at CSA (18/09-02/10/07) and it was even better than our first visit.
reviews.title: Loved Swept Away!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Check in was easy and very welcoming. We had a garden room which was very comfortable, large and wonderful A/C. The maids were great, came in daily and offered a night turn down service which is a nice touch.
reviews.title: Perfect Vacation

likes.liked: — views from the room, wonderful food, great staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Please dont listen to any negative reviews, this is lovers paradise, full of romance and couples spending every second together, its great.
reviews.title: Pleasant Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We met some great people and found it very hard to come home.
reviews.title: Nothing but Impressed

likes.liked: — We still had privacy with all our windows open.
likes.disliked: — Room amenities lack 5 star quality (for example: no conditioner in the shower)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I booked 10 days at Couples Swept Away. Our arrival at Sangster International Airport went very smooth once we got through the line-up. We checked into the Couples lounge and within 10 minutes our bags were loaded onto the shuttle and we were on our way. What was so great was we only had to make 1 stop before our resort to Couples Negril. Again at the resort the check-in was very smooth and we were taken to our room.
reviews.title: Wonderful holiday!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room
reviews.title: Great staff... but did not live up to expectations!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was a Beachfront Verandah Suite and was a corner suite situated on the second floor. Our first impression of the room was it had a real rustic charm. The beach view from our balcony was amazing. The room was perfect! As a little added touch there were exotic ginger flowers in the rooms and the ice bucket was filled everyday which was so convenient.
reviews.title: This place is special - Beware the Bob Marley shot will kill you mon

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: tip: My eyesight is not the best. Next time I will bring my own make-up mirror so I can take it into the natural light. The lighting in the bathrooms is a bit dim.
reviews.title: All-inclusive luxury at a fabulous beach resort with exceptional staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff
reviews.title: The service and the food stands out-highly recommend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: We had very high expectations, based on the TA reviews. Turns out, our trip was fantastic, but in ways that we had not expected. Keep in mind that the resort is low-rise; most buildings are 2 story units with 4 rooms each; a few had 3 stories. They are older style - white walls with wooden louvered windows and tile floors. The bathrooms are fine, with old style small tiles, and a walk in shower. We loved the charm and feel of the room -stayed in an Atrium Room, located between the Beach or Ocean Front rooms and the Garden Veranda Rooms which are closer to the road (yes, a little noisy). We liked the patio/balcony with hammock and the surrounding vegetation. The bed was king sized and filled with an assortment of pillows - we loved it. The property is very lush, filled with tropical plants and trees - very well kept - beautiful if you appreciate the natural setting. If you are looking for brand new, marble and granite, new fixtures, huge fountains like an Iberostar or Barcelo, this is not that kind of place. CSA has an old style feel to it and is relatively quiet and laid back. The setting along the beach is great, with the main restaurants at each end of the property, two small beach bars in between and a couple of casual beach restaurants in between. The pools are small and lightly used, but great for a cool off dip.
reviews.title: Swept Away by the Service and Staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: So, here’s the part that blew us all away – the service and personality of the staff. We have travelled all over the Caribbean and beyond. Never have we encountered staff more engaging, humorous and willing to please. Sure, we hit the occasional beach bartender who fell a little behind, but outside of that, the staff was unbelievable. This was the absolute highlight of our trip – the servers at the restaurants were all over us, conversational and funny, well trained and prompt. Everyone on the staff would take time out to talk, joke and listen to us whenever we engaged them in conversation. For us, this was the perfect blend of low-key, low rise ambiance along with a wonderful staff of very intelligent and sweet people.
reviews.title: Beautiful place. Amazing service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: So, what about the food? Feathers and Lemongrass are very good to excellent (this isn’t Chicago or New York). Hit and miss on a few entrees, but really good (keep in mind the great service). We loved the atmosphere of Lemongrass – an outdoor balcony with torches…Feathers is indoors and a little confined, but we were so engrossed with our food and the wait staff that we had a great time. The buffet at Palms for Breakfast, Lunch and Dinner was very good. At the other end of the property, Patios Patio served a la carte Breakfast and Dinner (we never had lunch there). Most of our lunches were at Seagrapes – a beach health/vegetarian casual place, or the Cabana Grill, serving casual outdoor grilled burgers, jerk chicken, sandwiches, wraps etc. So all-in-all, a good balance of casual and semi-formal settings…the Friday night Shipwreck Beach Party offered an incredible array of food and an acrobatic stage show…we loved it, but the crowd, in general, was mellow.
reviews.title: Home from Home
Fantastic, beautiful place, lovely people.
reviews.text: We really took advantage of all the included activities – available by signing up one day prior – glass bottom boat rides, snorkel trips, scuba diving, all several times a day. They also offered a morning fishing trip that we did not go on. A catamaran trip from 3:30 – sunset is also a must do, at least once. There were so many daily small activities around the pool – beading classes, margarita mixing/tasting, basket/hat weaving, Jamaican cooking….things that filled a little time and offered a break from the beach bar! Across the road is an incredible fitness area with tennis courts, pool, and running track.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The beach is great, a shallow and gradual slope with calm waters – great for walking and laying on the chair floats. Guards kept the beach vendors under control and we had no pressure from anyone.
reviews.title: wonderful wedding week, a true paradise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at the Couples for 12 days in October and we loved every minute of it. The staff is just lovely and helpful, but not because they have to; they really mean it! We rarely felt so welcome at a hotel before (and we do travel a lot all over the world). Kudos for their professionalism and attitude! The food is good to above average and the drinks are really above average, but the Feathers is just a copy of any regular restaurant you can find in Paris. Instead of trying to immitate a foreign culture, we would recommend the Manager to replace it with a restaurant that serves real gourmet Jamaican/Caribbean cuisine. My wife is alergic to garlic and Andre made a special meal for her everyday; that's what we call professional service! The beach is beautiful and the weather is perfect, but Negril is not what it used to be 10 years ago. There are just too many resorts now and we can image how crowded it must be during the high season. We had our first experience with the nasty small bugs called "sand flies". You can't see them until they have eaten the heck out of you; and the bites really hurt. So, don't forget your bugg-off spray when in the beach. Our room was perfect, confortable, clean, with a lot of space and with good privacy. We did not have a TV though and we could not care less about it! . We recommend the old rooms closer to the front-desk but try to stay far from the Patio's or the beach, unless you like to wake up with music. We used the gym every day but we did not go to the nightclub. Cosman (the guy with a yellow t-shirt) is the man when it comes to activities. Overall, we had an awesome vacation. Again, thanks for Andre (our 5 stars chef), Oshane, Portia, Aldaine and all the lovely staff of Couples. You made our stay one of the best so far.
reviews.title: The best staff on Earth!

likes.disliked: — Bugs and noisy and drunk Americans

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We went to couples for our honeymoon and it was fabulous! The people are so great there, very laid back, and the food was awesome! Breakfast, lunch, and dinner was great at every restaraunt! We stayed in an beachffron verandah suite which was nice. The view was great, and the drinks in the room were nice to have. Definitely do the water activites-ask for Nunez and he'll teach you anything you want to learn. Overall a great experience, we will go back for our annivesaries for sure!
reviews.title: great trip, great people!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our 4th time to Couple's Swept Away. Since discovering this place, we can't think of any other resort on any other island that we would rather spend a tropical vacation at (and we've been to many others). CSA has everything we want and more. The original section's accommodations are our choice because of the bungalow style rooms. Only four units to a building, with shuttered walls and screens, no glass. With the shutters all open, it's like a private hut right on the beach. With the shutters closed and the air conditioning on, it's cool and very private. Best of both worlds and very romantic. And the balconies or verandahs are extremely large providing a great oasis from the hot sun or passing rain storm. The second floor rooms have hammocks to take a nap in or just read a good book. But if your looking for luxurious, this is not for you. No TV's and only the beachfront suites have mini-bars. The newer section replicates the original but is not as rustic. All have TV and mini-bars, with smaller balconies or verandahs.
reviews.title: Another perfect vacation...........

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007
reviews.text: The food is great at all of the restaurants. Entertainment is offered every evening and for those who like to party into the wee hours, there is a Disco that opens at 11:00 and stays open until the last person leaves. Most people, however, retire early and wake up early to enjoy what has to be one of the most beautiful beaches in all the Caribbean. If you are a true beach person, Negril and Couple's Swept Away is a dream come true.
reviews.title: Paradise on Earth - Wonderful honeymoon!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The biggest reason we keep returning to CSA and to Jamaica is because of the wonderful island people. They are the friendliest, warmest and happiest people in all the Caribbean. The staff at CSA will make you feel welcome from the moment you arrive. By the time you leave, you are family. Many first timers we ran into on this trip left vowing to return. There is something magical about Jamaica, Negril and Couple's Swept Away that can't be described unless you see and feel for yourself.
reviews.title: Loved it here

likes.disliked: — That i didn't get to stay longer

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If I had to select one word to describe our stay at CSA, it would be: DISAPPOINTED.
reviews.title: Not the CSA it once was....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We'd had visited before when the resort was half the size, always selecting an atrium room, and found CSA to be lovely.
reviews.title: Relaxing vacation at Swept Away

likes.liked: — Beautifulbeach,fantastic food, great views, included mini bar with liquor and great maid service

reviews.title: Great but be careful when selecting room catagory
reviews.text: This time it felt like two resorts pushed together, experiencing growing pains. Clearly they need more staff.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We started in an atrium room, after two nights of zero sleep (we were in a room between The Palms and the road) rather than complaining, we paid to upgrade to a Oceanview Veranda Suite. Wise choice, wish we had booked this from the start. The air in our atrium couldn't keep it cool and with the lack of the old TV room (which is now the kitchen for Lemongrass) we didn't have a place to really cool down. New room was great - cooler, no road noise, added bonus of the tv.
reviews.title: Just go there!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The beach was great (yes, some seaweed, but not as bad as the typical beach in the Mid-Atlantic USA area), the bar service was the best we've encountered at the resort (yes, some bees, it's natural tho given the environment), the food and service at Feathers was the best we've experienced at CSA, we even enjoyed the original pool (I must admit in previous trips we hadn't even stuck our toes in it). Snorkeling was great, the added trip in the afternoon helps (now at 11am 1:30 pm and 3pm), but we didn't want to literally line up for water sking, etc...so this was much missed as we enjoyed this on previous trips. The resort size doubled, but not the water sports staff or equipment.
reviews.title: Back in Camp for a Week

likes.disliked: — Location next to main road/highway & resort on two sides of the road

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our first experience with a couples only club. We expected a quiet and relaxing holiday with a lot of activities in luxury surroundings. Coming from Europe, we paid a hefty price for that. We were aware that this was mainly an American vacation spot and do not consider this s a disadvantage, on the contrary.
reviews.title: Excellent services and facilities but overcrowed and noisy, not a five star!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was intended to be a diving holiday as well.
reviews.title: Unforgettable Vacation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The good:
reviews.title: The Good and Not So Good

likes.liked: — The beachfront view from our room (#4317).

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - Large choice of sports, restaurants, bars
reviews.title: Solid resort, we'd go back.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - two specialty and one table service restaurant with sofisticated food
reviews.title: A very nice place!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just returned from a 2-week stay, 25 Feb - 10 March.
reviews.title: CSA is ace for tennis players

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: >Summary: Had an excellent experience overall - will return! Staff all warm and friendly in our experience. A couple of slow service moments in our two week visit, but no significant problems.
reviews.title: Second visit to CSA

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: >TENNIS: We wanted a resort with a big tennis focus - but not a "boot camp" atmosphere - and got just that. Daily morning drills Mon - Fri are run by a visiting coach (Roberta from Treviso, Italy in week 1, then Robin from Louisville, Kentucky USA in week 2). These sessions were well-attended, and well-managed by the coaches. This was a good way to meet fellow players, and sort out casual games for later in the day. The visiting coach also hosts the daily 5pm Round Robin tournament (Mon - Fri). Daily prizes for the winners. :-) There is also a resident coaching team, who are available for daily (including Sat/Sun) 30-min private lessons. These are INCLUDED in your all-inclusive! Just book up to 2 days ahead at the Sport Centre. My own experiences with David, Ashton and Norson were all productive - they are all very observant, and can sort out "niggles" in your play. (Note there are also squash and raquetball courts on-site. Rental rackets are available, but you must have athletic shoes.) There are green clay and hard courts, all in very good condition. Courts are lit at night on request/when you book courts - there is no light fee.
reviews.title: Excellent Choice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: >Check-in: We arrived relatively late off of a UK flight (8pm), so no wait for the room or to check-in. The gentleman handling our check-in was efficient, smiling, and pleasant. Our keys "blanked out" twice during our stay, a minor hassle but fixed immediately and pollitey by the desk team. Check-out had no wait in our case, and the bill was correct and all OK.
reviews.title: First timer to Jamaica

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: >Keys: If you have a ground-floor room, may be helpful to ask for a patio door key (20 USD refundable deposit). Housekeeping does sometimes lock the deadbolt though, so carried key card as backup plan.
reviews.title: Almost Perfect!
Add us to the Repeaters List!
reviews.text: Departure

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We left from New York JFK to Montego Bay. Our flight was at 9:30 am so we had to be at the airport by at least 6:30 am. We woke up at 4:30 am to get there. Out flight left an hour late because there were a lot of flights leaving at the same time. We got to Montego Bay around 1:30 pm their time. They have done work in the airport. It is huge. It was a long way to walk before getting to the customs line. The line was long for the customs. The air-conditioner wasn’t working and it was hot. It took about an hour to clear customs, pick up our luggage and get to the lounge. Hubby got a Red stripe and I just got water. There were a lot of people waiting at the lounge. Most of them were going to CSA. We left after about 15 or 20 minutes. The ride wasn’t bad. It was raining. We made one stop on the way for about 10 or 15 minutes.
reviews.title: Breathtaking Beach, Highly Recommended!
2nd Time, and absolutely not the last...
reviews.text: Arrival

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We got to the resort around 4:30 pm. They gave us cold towels which smelled so nice and champagne. My hubby and I are diabetic. We hadn’t eaten all this time. They gave us food in the plane but that was about 4 or 5 hours before. My hubby was hungry and we asked the staff and they were very helpful and told him how to get to Seagrapes to grab something to eat. While waiting in the lounge for the room keys and filling out paperwork and since we got there before 5:00 pm, I went and made reservations for the restaurants for that night and the next night. They had openings for all the restaurants. I didn’t want to get dressed up for Feathers so I booked Patios Patio for Thursday night and Lemongrass for Friday night. I waited in the lounge, checked in and one of the guys took my bags to my room.
reviews.title: Swept Away At Times

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Okay seriously, this is and always be our favorite vacation destination. My wife and I are in our Mid 20's and honeymooned here, and loved it so much we came back again in August of last year. Don't believe or let the nay sayers scare you away on here. Some people are just so darned determined to find the worst in everything. Trust me, I have vacationed all over Mexico, Hawaii, and the Carribean, and Jamaica is amazing, and CSA is the only way to go! Awesome food, I highly recommend "Lemongrass" their Thai resturant, Excellent! As well as all the others. (Feathers is not our favorite, but thats only because fancy French cuisine is not our favorite :)
reviews.title: Will Always be our favorite

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Beach is by far the best I have ever been to, whether it be Hawaii, Mexico, Puerto Rico, St Thomas, St Marteen, or Bahamas! Imagine this...you are laying at the beach after breakfast and just about the time you are needing refreshment (usually around 11 am) the beach staff come around and hand you a green flag on a stick to put in the sand any time you would like something to drink, and they bring it right to you! And as the sun is beating down on you, another staff member brings around little towels soaked in ice water to cool yourself down with. And just when you don't think it could get any better, another staff member comes by with a platter of chilled fresh fruit cabobs! Wow, amazing service!
reviews.title: Were we at the same resort?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms are great, we stayed in the Beachfront suites both times, Amazing! Staff is great, the boys in the sports hut are awesome and very helpful if you wanna take out a Hobbie Cat or other water entertainment, (water skiing, wake boarding, kayaks etc.)
reviews.title: If I only had one vacation left in my life, this would be it.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The spa treatments are amazing...a must splurge while you are there!
reviews.title: A wonderful all-inclusive in a beautiful setting!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When choosing your vacation location, remember when reading reviews, that you MUST go with the overwhelming majority for what to believe. You will always have a few..."bad apples" who are snobby party poopers who view anything different than the "Ritz Carlton" shabby and old.
reviews.title: We will not return

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at CSA for my 50th Birthday February 14 to 21st. Have traveled extensively to much larger all inclusives in the Carribean and Mexico. Was a little shocked initally as CSA is small and quaint without the large flashy lobby that we had become a custom to. Once we settled in after a small glitch with our room that was resolved by front office manager, Lenise. The trip was off to a super start. Lenise went over and above to get us into a room that we loved! The resort is layed back with great service and food. Loved the food at Lemon Grass and Feathers as well as the beach snack bar. Only ate buffet food for lunch one day and it was good as well. We had a small glitch with room service brekfast which was immediately taken care of by the chef and Mr.Neville Morris. The food services staff proved that our satisfaciton was first and foremost. The staff and the service were the highlight of the trip. The room and grounds were just average as the property is a little older but location is great and beach fantastic. The staff that went over and above to make our vacation and my 50th Birthday very special were Ms. Lenise, front office; Mr. Neville Morris, Food Service; Ricky & Wendy, Swim up Bar; Peter, Beach Green Flag Service; Foster, Photographer; Crefton, Kevon & Evon, Patios Resteraunt. Overall, my Birthday vacation with my wife was very special at CSA. We will be back as the trip was very memorable, with food, staff service, and property location second to none. Thanks Lenise for setting the stage! You made it happen from the start!
reviews.title: Will Be Sending Our Son To CSA For His Honeymoon In October

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff is friendly and very helpful. The folks at Patios were kind, funny and very proud of their restaurant. We ate almost all of our meals at Patios because we could dress up or walk in after hanging out in the hot tub. Although the menu is limited, everything on it is good. Halfway through the week, they change the menu. The Thai restaurant, Lemon Grass, is worth the advance reservation. Enjoy a lemon drop or chocolate martini before your table is ready. Sea Grapes Cafe is a great choice for a light lunch - the snapper was perfect! Food is made to order at most of CSA's restaurants, so don't expect fast service.
reviews.title: Especially great for travelers who take advantage of all CSA has to offer

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Negril has a beautiful beach to walk. You can walk as far as you want. The security guards, at times, will wave you over to note where you are from. No one cares where you are going. If you try to explore another resorts property, you will probably get stopped. As you walk, the beach you will be asked to rent a jet ski, go parasailing, snorkel or smoke. If you aren't interested, just say no. And that's it. No problem means no problem.
reviews.title: All inclusive really means all inclusive

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you like being on the beach and you're an early riser, I suggest before you go on your morning run or walk that you snag a spot between 7:00-7:30 am. Leave a towel and tee shirt on the chairs your want you can probably get a hammock or a spot under an umbrella. If you don't, you'll still find a great spot to soak up the sun or read in the shade.
reviews.title: Wow, wow and more wow

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The week I was there, we played some serious volleyball! The people who played always encouraged and welcomed players in, even after the games started. We had games that could last two hours. Don't worry they always made time for Red Stripe breaks in between games.
reviews.title: Better than Expected
Couples Swept Away - A Perfect Vacation in Paradise
reviews.text: CSA was the perfect vacation and a wonderful 5th anniversary. The resort was perfect in every way. We were deciding between the “S” resort and Couples for a long time. We like the pictures of the rooms in the “S” resort. Looks very plush. However we couldn’t get what we wanted for the money we wanted to spend. The proximity to the beach, and the niceness of the beach, and the amenities just weren’t there with the “S” resort, unless you were willing to spend a lot of money, and it seemed you would get treated differently based on what room you booked. So this is what made us decide on Couples, and we are so glad we did. And we are so glad we chose CSA. This will probably become our yearly vacation spot.

reviews.title: If you find fault with Couples Swept Away you should just stay home!!!
reviews.text: Couples Lounge – Again didn’t look as plush as the other lounges, but the people were so nice. We didn’t get to enjoy having any drinks there because there was a bus leaving as soon as we arrived and we were anxious to get to the resort. It looked very nice.

reviews.title: Nothing like it anywhere, be careful what you wish for because you will get it
reviews.text: Ride to the resort – is fine. A little long, but goes fast, and it’s a nice ride to see the countryside. The ride shouldn’t deter you from booking CSA. Enjoyable both ways.

reviews.title: My New Favorite Vacation Spot
reviews.text: Check in - Welcome at the resort is just as people have written about. Men will pick out the luggage, and the ladies will go start the check in process. We had gotten our request and were so happy. They brought champagne and cold towels. We were then walked to our room. The person that assisted us and oriented us to the room was so nice.

reviews.title: our BEST anniversary !!
reviews.text: Credits – If you have gift shop credit or spa credit. Make your reservations to the spa, and bring credit with you. You will have to use it all at once. For the gift shop, just sign things to the room, and at the end, bring your credit to check out, and they will deduct this.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you are looking for the ultimate beach getaway---look no further than Swept Away. I have traveled to MANY beach destinations and this is by far my absolute favorite. You could not ask for a more idyllic or beautiful beach location. Keep in mind you will more than likely be flying into Montego Bay and Negril is a good 1.5 hour drive away. I would really not recommend this area for less than a 4 day vacation minimum. Otherwise, you will not be there long enough to relax, unwind and truly realize what a laid-back, carefree destination you have booked.
reviews.title: PARADISE

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: IF YOU ARE LOOKING FOR:
reviews.title: Loved Couples Swept Away

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: an all-night party
reviews.title: Swept away was amazing!!

likes.liked: — the privacy of the room we picked looking out only the tops of the palms and the blue ocean!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: loud music
reviews.title: Never dissapointed with CSA!!!!!

likes.liked: — The bed and the mini bar

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: cruise-like atmosphere
reviews.title: Exceded our expectations

likes.liked: — The overall value, the landscaping and the layout

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have to start by making a statement in MY opinion, this is no offense to anyone but I feel it needs to be addressed...After I visited this beautiful place, I have come to find that this is a resort that is meant only for certain people, when I say that I mean ONLY people who don't COMPLAIN, and I mean people who complain about every ity bity thing. I honestly, in my humble opinion cannot FATHOM why on earth anyone would have anything to complain about when it comes to Couples, it's Jamaica and you are at one of the best resorts in the world...NOTHING is perfect and for people to complain about certain issues that the staff has no control over is totally obsured....some people are waiting to complain about anything...sad...
reviews.title: ~Don't listen or READ the complainers!!~

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived in at 6:25am in Jamaica and headed towards the Couples Lounge, we were off to the shuttle in 20 mins. The bus ride was not bad, I fell asleep due to my husband sprawling out across me on the flight there and I couldn't get a wink in. We first dropped 2 couples off to CN and I started getting excited in the worst way, my husband did too, be he'll front like he didn't. When we arrived, we were greeted w/the infamous cold towels champagne. While I was signing the papers for our room (which took only 5 minutes SERIOUSLY) another couple who was leaving were telling us how jealous they were and how they wanted to stay, my husand sat down and after one sip of the champagne he totally opened up to the other couple and they talked his ear off. Within, 5 - 7 min we had our keys to the room. I requested room 2223 but we got room 2125 which was PERFECT because we were like 20 steps from the beach and every morning our breakfast was brought to our back verandah.
reviews.title: Didn't measure up

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room itself was ROMANTIC, so great! A few ants but no big deal, just get a tissue and trash the boogers. Closet space and shelf space was enough for the biggest packer. The safe was big enough for all valuables except for hubby's laptop, so we just locked it in my suitcase with my TSA lock when we left the room. That laptop is his baby, so he is that was with it.
reviews.title: CSA Negril is a winner!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I won't be able to touch everything, just things that I want to express and things I feel are important and these things are not in date order.
reviews.title: Beautiful, romantic resort (destination wedding)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006
reviews.text: When we first arrived we ate at the Cabana girl because I wanted those beef patties and the fish sandwhich...YUMMY!!!! The ambience was totally priceless. The beach is without words, the pictures do it some justice but not ALL.
reviews.title: All Around Great Time
Second time even better than the first
reviews.text: Reading some of the other reviews it is hard to imagine we were at the same place. I have to wonder if many of them had done much research before going.

reviews.title: Relax, and you will love it!!
reviews.text: I will begin my review after arriving at the resort. I believe others have already given a pretty good idea what to expect for the ride to Negril and our experience is pretty much the same as what everyone else has reported.

reviews.title: Practically perfect, can't wait to return!
reviews.text: We traveled with a group of 20 so the check in process for us was longer than I would expect for most. There were several other couples not with our group who arrived at the same time so it probably took 15-20 minutes to get checked in. They seemed pretty well prepared for us to be arriving but it still takes time to run everyone's credit cards and to fill out the paperwork. Once completed we were off to our rooms.

reviews.title: Utterly amazing time - loved it!!
reviews.text: Having been to the resort last year we already knew where to find our room. We were assigned room 3203 which was a second floor Garden Verandah. We had a decent view from our verandah. The trees blocked any view of the water, but there was a pond nearby and the jacuzzi could be seen from our verandah. The room itself was very clean and we had no complaints. Our room was cleaned every day while we were out and about and the bed turned down while we were at dinner. We never saw the person in charge of taking care of our room but she did a great job. I suppose if I were to be critical there was some mildew in the shower and the wood trim was not perfect. However, the only reason I even noticed was because I was going to take pictures of the shower and only noticed it at that time. It had zero impact on our vacation and did not effect our view of the resort in any way. If you are someone who would have your vacation ruined by such things you will probably want to vacation elsewhere.

reviews.title: Wonderful!!!
reviews.text: We arrived on a Friday about 5pm so our first activity was the beach party. We missed it last year so were very excited to try it this year. The food was fantastic and we had a lot of fun. It was set up buffet style on the beach and there was so much to choose from. The entertainment looked pretty good but we were very tired from a long day traveling so we headed to bed pretty early.

reviews.title: Fantastic Trip
reviews.text: I did a lot of research before we booked this resort and it exceeded our expectations on all counts. The beach is stunning,the resort beautiful and well maintained. We stayed in a Great House Verandah Suite which was clean, spacious and comfortable. We had a partial view of the beach from our balcony.

reviews.title: Paradise - again
reviews.text: The staff were friendly and helpful. They actually seem to enjoy their jobs,unlike the staff in a lot of the hotels that I've stayed in.

reviews.title: ARE YOU KIDDING ME?
reviews.text: The food was great, so much choice! My partner is a little on the fussy side so I was concerned that he would find it difficult to find something he liked! I needn't have worried he more than happy with what was on offer. Make sure you visit the Martini Bar!

reviews.title: Incredible experience!!!!
reviews.text: We went on the Catarmaran Cruise and the Shopping Trip which were fun. Be aware of 'friendly' locals in Negril town centre who want to befriend you - for a price of course!

reviews.title: Its all about the beach - Said the kangaroo (you had to be there)
reviews.text: This was our first trip to the Caribbean and my first experience of an All Inclusive Resort - well all I can say following our stay at Swept Away is how do we top this trip!?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a wonderful first visit to Jamaica and Couples Swept Away. It is a beautiful resort with great staff who made the experience awesome. The food was good for the most part. We were celebrating our 30th wedding anniversary and Feathers Restaurant was our planned fine dining event but unfortunately the food was not only inferior to the other restaurants, we did not eat any of it. The other restaurants had great food. The front desk staff were less than friendly and treated us as intruders as we checked in and made restaurant reservations but ALL other staff were superior in their customer service skills. We had an ultimate and relaxing experience and took advantage of all the water sports. I would definitely consider returning in the future.
reviews.title: Awesome time at CSA 2/25 - 3/3/12

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I just spent a week at Couples Swept Away. It was our second time to this resort, we stayed there last year around the same time. All I can say is wow, what a great place. The beach was great although they lost some of their beach this year. We rented a jet ski from Jimmy and for $40 he let us go all the way to Rick's Cafe and then all the way to Sandals at the other end of the beach. My husband learned how to sail a Hobby Cat and that was fantastic, a must do on vacation.
reviews.title: Another great vacation!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This year we got a beachfront verandah suite and these have to be the best rooms on the resort. The rooms were clean and the mini fridge was stocked everyday.
reviews.title: Simply Amazing!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As repeat guests we went to a special dinner for repeat customers and the meal was fantastic. Beef tenderloin and lobster tail.
reviews.title: Excellent, fantastic, all we expected and even more!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have been to Cancun, Manzanillo, Puerto Vallarta and Ocho Rios...Negril is by far the best place we've been to and I don't think we will go anywhere else.
reviews.title: Gotta Love One Love

description: Immediately upon entering Couples Swept Away, you realize that you have arrived in paradise. Exotic flowers bloom amidst acres of green—on seven miles of the purest white sand beach in Negril, Jamaica. Dotted among the tropical gardens—open-air cafes, small pool enclaves and fresh fruit oases are yours to discover. Never crowded or hurried, the resort offers an intimate tranquility and when desired, total seclusion. All rooms embrace a quiet elegance with island cedar furnishings and pure white linens. Plantation shutters open onto private verandahs with views of gardens and azure sea. Breezy open-air restaurants engage candle-lit lanterns and billowing white curtains to strike a romantic note. While the pristine 10-acre sports complex encompasses every imaginable activity, the superb spa serves as a haven of relaxation. Couples Swept Away simply captures your heart and soothes your soul.
